title: Certified Practitioner for Lifelong Learning and Competency Development | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Master coaching techniques to foster 21st-century skills, resilience, and well-being, while developing effective strategies for personal and professional growth.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Certified Practitioner for Lifelong Learning and Competency Development
Certified Practitioner for Lifelong Learning and Competency Development
Master coaching techniques to foster 21st-century skills, resilience, and well-being, while developing effective strategies for personal and professional growth.

In today’s evolving educational landscape, coaching has become an essential tool to empower educators and people developers, fostering personal and professional growth in individuals through evidence-based practices and transformative strategies.

Over the past decade, coaching has gained significant traction in education and non-profit sectors, proving effective in fostering the development of key competencies and enhancing learning outcomes. By integrating coaching into curricula and pedagogy, educators can guide individuals toward holistic growth, fostering adaptability, resilience, and lifelong learning.

Coaching drives meaningful transformation by utilising techniques such as deep listening, strategic questioning, and goal setting. By equipping educators with these powerful tools, coaching fosters the growth of participants who are not only knowledgeable but also adaptable and resilient in an ever-changing world.

This programme is designed for educators and people developers looking to enhance their coaching and mentoring skills across multiple domains. It focuses on developing 21st-century competencies, fostering technical expertise, lifelong learning habits and promoting well-being. By integrating evidence-based practices from the science of learning and positive psychology, participants will gain the necessary skills to support self-regulation, deep learning strategies, and resilience.

The programme consists of four focused modules that teach participants how to conduct impactful coaching conversations, assess competencies, and promote mental health. Upon completion of the program, participants will have developed coaching competencies that enable them to engage others with empathy, confidence, and the ability to support both personal and professional growth.
For those seeking to be recognised as certified practitioners in the Academy registry, there are key competencies that must be demonstrated across four modules.
Module A: Demonstrate the ability to apply solution-focused coaching techniques to support learner development and drive growth.
Module B: Integrate evidence-based coaching practices in education and professional development to foster lifelong learning and continuous growth.
Module C: Analyse, assess, and coach technical competencies by breaking them down into measurable components, and offering targeted feedback to enhance skill mastery.
Module D: Implement positive psychology coaching strategies to promote resilience, mental health, and holistic well-being for learners.

Upon completing the full 4-part programme and successfully demonstrating the required competencies through assignments, participants will be certified as Coaching for Competencies (C4C practitioners).

This course is designed for educators and teachers across institutions like JC, Poly, ITE, and universities, education professionals such as success coaches, and professionals training or teaching in their domain of expertise.

It is suitable for workplace trainers, supervisors, managers, human resource professionals, adult educators, self-directed learners, freelance education and training professionals, and NACE trainers seeking to enhance their coaching and development skills.
Module A: Coaching conversations for 21st century competencies in lifelong learners – the solution-focused approach
Identify opportunities to initiate meaningful coaching
Demonstrate solution-focused coaching techniques to support personal and professional development
Implement strategies to foster critical 21st-century competencies in various educational settings
Facilitate goal setting and action planning to promote competency-based education
Develop skills to establish a positive and constructive coaching environment
Module B: Coaching with the science of learning – towards self-regulation for lifelong learning
Explore the principles of the science of learning and their application in coaching
Implement strategies to enhance learners' self-regulation and metacognitive skills
Facilitate the development of lifelong learning habits through goal setting and reflection
Evaluate learners’ profiles and coach them in adopting deep and organised learning strategies for sustained growth
Module C: Mastering the art of coaching technical competencies – an applied approach for professionals
Deconstruct technical competencies into observable and measurable components
Develop skills in accurately observing and evaluating domain-specific competencies
Deliver, precise and targeted feedback to support the development of technical skills
Apply coaching techniques to support and accelerate learners' mastery of specialised competencies
Module D: Coaching and mentoring lifelong learners for well-being and health – a positive psychology approach
Explore the foundational principles of positive psychology and their application in coaching for well-being
Implement evidence-based strategies to prevent burnout and promote mental health in educational settings
Develop skills to mentor individuals in building resilience
Apply positive psychology techniques to enhance overall well-being and maintain a healthy study and work-life balance
Associate Professor/Assistant Provost (Applied Learning), Health and Social Sciences, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor/Assistant Provost (Applied Learning), Health and Social Sciences, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr May Lim is an Associate Professor and Assistant Provost (Applied Learning) at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT). She is the first occupational therapist in Singapore to be awarded the Doctoral of Philosophy (PhD) qualification. She started the Bachelor of Science (with Honours) in Occupational Therapy degree at SIT in 2016. May was also involved in national projects such as providing consultancy to early intervention centres. Currently, she serves at the SPD Board, volunteers as trainer at CaringSG, and partners Dementia Singapore on research initiatives. She continues her clinical practice on Friday mornings with young children with developmental delays.

May led a centre that looks after learning and teaching development at the university level from 2017 – 2022. She actively builds a coaching culture for educators to develop students beyond the classroom. She won the university Teaching Excellence Award in 2016, 2018 and 2020 and Education 2.0 Outstanding Leadership Award, National Day Honours: Public Administration Medal (Bronze) in 2022. Her research interests are transition, coaching, self-efficacy and resilience, approaches to learning, and developmental disabilities. She is a certified Solution-Focused Coach with CCPC Global, Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with International Coaching Federation (ICF) and Certified Positive Intelligence Coach.
Assistant Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology
Armed with 20 years of corporate experience in APAC's Media and Marketing industry, Angela honed her skills as a Media Strategist specialising in human-experience design.

After living overseas in Australia, the USA, China and Hong Kong for 15 years, Angela returned to Singapore in 2016 to deploy her work and life experiences fully to the area of learning and development. She became an adjunct lecturer with HLIs and also continues to train professionals in the Ad-marcom industry and leadership skills in other organisations.

Angela pursued the path of lifelong learning with Anglia Ruskin University in MSc Applied Positive Psychology with a focus on the study of emotions. Her research and study of emotions accumulated to the publishing of an activity book, "What Colours Are You Feeling?" that aims to help adults and children develop emotional awareness and literacy skills. Her experiences in Design Thinking and expanded scope to Positive Psychology also led her to speak at TEDx Singapore 2019 on "Design Think To Happiness". The interest in leveraging emotional insights to design better leadership in the workplace and life, has Angela to pursuing her PhD with the University of Reading, UK.
Senior Educational Developer, SIT Teaching and Learning Academy, Singapore Institute of Technology
Senior Educational Developer, SIT Teaching and Learning Academy, Singapore Institute of Technology

Ramesh is an executive coach and educational development specialist with the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT). He leads coaching training and learning programmes for faculty development at the university for the advancement of their professional capabilities as academics and in becoming effective educational leaders.

Ramesh is a credentialed International Coaching Federation (ICF) coach and a Professional Certified Corporate Coach from Singapore Management University. He has served on the Board and in various Committees of the ICF Singapore Chapter and is an active member in various coaching communities of practice.

Ramesh has worked in Singapore, Hong Kong, and the USA, in diverse corporate roles and entrepreneurial ventures. His coaching practice and research interests include academic, leadership, mindfulness, positive psychology, solution-focused, supervision, team and youth coaching. He is co-editor and writer for the book, “Coaching Students in Higher Education: A Solution-Focused Approach to Retention, Performance and Wellbeing”, published by Routledge in 2024.
Senior Educational Developer, SIT Teaching and Learning Academy, Singapore Institute of Technology
Senior Educational Developer, SIT Teaching and Learning Academy, Singapore Institute of Technology

With over 15 years of experience in education, Bavani has worked closely with learners to support meaningful learning and continuous growth. She began her journey with eight years at Singapore’s Ministry of Education (MOE), where she developed expertise in fostering student development. She later transitioned to higher education, working with diverse learners, including adult learners, to support their academic and personal growth.

Bavani’s background in educational psychology, with a Master’s in Education (NTU) specialising in Developmental Psychology and an ongoing doctoral studies (NTU) focusing on learning and motivation, shapes her approach to fostering self-regulated learning and reflective practices.

At SIT, Bavani has facilitated programs like the "Learning to Learn Better" module, which equips students with strategies for academic success and personal growth. She also piloted a learning series to develop metacognitive skills and promote lifelong learning. These initiatives enabled her to create supportive environments that encourage reflection, resilience, and a growth mindset.
Bavani is eager to collaborate with aspiring coaches and educators, sharing practices and insights to empower learners to unlock their potential and embrace continuous growth.
Senior Manager, SIT Teaching and Learning Academy, Singapore Institute of Technology
Senior Manager, SIT Teaching and Learning Academy, Singapore Institute of Technology

Peck Chee is a Success Coach in the Teaching and Learning Academy with the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), supporting the Competency-based Stackable Micro-credential (CSM) pathway. She is part of the team that set up success coaching in SIT.

Peck Chee has 20 years of talent development experience in the private and public sectors. She worked with internal and external stakeholders to develop talent and deliver successful business outcomes. She pioneered leadership development, organisation development and coaching initiatives that set organisational leadership and coaching cultures. She is most proud of her contributions to building organisation leaders who are today’s industry leaders.

Peck Chee enjoys facilitating professional and personal growth. In her professional capacity, she has coached organisational leaders, organisational talent, adult learners and career seekers. In her personal capacity, she is a volunteer coach and mentor, coaching working adults and young adults.

Peck Chee holds a Bachelor of Arts degree from the National University of Singapore. She is a certified Dale Carnegie Trainer, Career Facilitation Practitioner, Certified Behavioural Career Consultant and accredited in Myers Brigg Type Indicator, Fundamental Interpersonal Relationship Orientation-Behaviour and Hogan assessments. She is currently pursuing her coaching certification with the International Coaching Federation.
Deputy Director, Digital Transformation Office, Singapore Institute of Technology
Deputy Director, Digital Transformation Office, Singapore Institute of Technology
"Technology is in my DNA; coaching is my passion."

Shok Been is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation (ICF) and a certified Advanced Solution Focus Coach with the Academy of Solution-Focused Training (ASFT). She has over 30 years of experience spanning from business, people and operations management to consulting, with government agencies, private enterprises, and NGOs. She is recognised for building and coaching high-performing teams, and continuously introducing new concepts in technology, process, and personal development. Her key strengths lie in her engagement with business stakeholders and bridging business strategies with technology, which brings her to her current role in the Digital Transformation Office of the Singapore Institute of Technology.

Shok Been has worked with education-related NGOs, international schools, and Shanghai consulate of Singapore in Shanghai since 2011. She is also a mentor with Asia Institute of Mentoring and Halogen Foundation Singapore as well as supporting young IT professionals in their career journeys. Currently, she is pursuing the Advanced Certification for Team Coaching with ICF and has conducted several team coaching sessions with NGOs and companies. Moving forward, she aims to share her multifaceted experiences with organisations and the community, coaching and motivating them towards professional and personal growth.
Global Executive Coach, Educator, Coach Supervisor and Mentor
Global Executive Coach, Educator, Coach Supervisor and Mentor

Josephine Teo is a global executive coach, mentor coach and supervisor, as well as coach educator with over 30 years of public and private-sector experiences. She has held managerial and leadership positions in various functions ranging from management and operations to communications and marketing. She has some 15 years of experience in the coaching, education and corporate training areas.

Her coaching experiences include instructional and leadership coaching, with clients ranging from professors and PhD students to MBA students and corporate executives. Josephine has deep experience in competency-based adult education. Academically, she has taught courses from PhD and Masters to polytechnic students, in both PET and CET spaces, as well as management education learning institutes.
She holds a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential with the International Coaching Federation (ICF) and is a volunteer leader on the ICF Singapore chapter board.

: Doctor in Education (EdD); MBA (Dean’s List), Bachelor of Fine Arts (Film and Television); Diploma with Merit in Mass Communication; Specialist Diploma in Sports and Exercise Sciences; Diploma in Adult and Continuing Education, Advanced Certificate in Training and Assessment.
: About 10 years of coaching experience in learning and instruction, presentation, leadership development, career management, personal and professional well-being.

: ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC); Diploma in Coaching Supervision; INSEAD Advanced Group Coaching; INSEAD Coaching Certificate; SMU International Corporate Coaching Programme; International Systemic Team Coaching Certificate, Certified Career Coach.
Module A: Coaching conversations for 21st century competencies in lifelong learners – the solution-focused approach

This two-day session equips educators and people developers with solution-focused techniques to facilitate meaningful growth. Participants will explore strategies to foster key 21st-century competencies, such as collaboration and communication. Through practical exercises and case studies, they will develop the skills to guide individuals toward self-directed, competency-based growth. This session emphasises the importance of positive dialogue and empowers participants to support individuals in identifying their strengths, setting goals, and crafting actionable plans for success.
Module B: Coaching with the science of learning – towards self-regulation for lifelong learning

This one-day session focuses on the synergy between coaching practices and the science of learning It emphasises fostering self-regulation skills essential for lifelong learning. Participants will delve into evidence-based strategies to help individuals build metacognitive skills, enhance their ability to set and achieve goals and cultivate a growth-oriented mindset. Through interactive sessions and hands-on experiments, participants will learn to guide individuals to become more self-directed and adaptive, ready to thrive in the ever-evolving demands of the 21st century.
Module C: Mastering the Art of Coaching Technical Competencies – An Applied Approach for Professionals

This one-day session equips participants with the expertise to coach in specialised domains effectively. Participants will learn to deconstruct technical competencies into measurable and observable components, enabling precise assessment and guidance. It emphasises the importance of providing constructive feedback in developing domain-specific skills. Through practical exercises, participants will refine their ability to support individuals in mastering technical competencies, ensuring they meet industry standards and excel in their fields.
Module D: Coaching and mentoring lifelong learners for well-being and health – a positive psychology approach

This one-day session focuses on enhancing well-being and preventing burnout through evidence-based positive psychology practices. Participants will gain the knowledge and skills to coach and mentor individuals in building resilience and supporting mental health. By integrating scientifically-backed strategies, the session emphasises fostering positive emotions, engagement, and effective coping strategies. Participants will learn to apply positive psychology principles to help individuals to prevent burnout and support recover and promote sustained well-being and productivity.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.

In addition to the Certificate of Attainment, participants seeking certification for C4C will have three months to submit evidence of their competencies, such as an analysed audio transcript and a comprehensive portfolio. A record will be maintained for certified individuals, who will be eligible to use the title Certified Coaching for Competencies (C4C) Practitioner.
For non-certified participants: Multiple-choice questions based on case studies.

For certification as C4C practitioners: Participants must submit a 30-45 minute video or audio recording of a coaching conversation, a reflection on their practice, and pass a short exam on the science of learning.
The full fee for this course is S$5,450.00.
Funded under SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy (MCES)
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
